availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis L. Wicks (Hopkins County, Kentucky, day laborer )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, day laborer. Kentucky native. Son of John L. Wicks and Nancy Wicks. Married to Susan E. Wicks. Father of Meredith Wicks, Lewis Wicks, Martha Wicks, Henry Wicks, and Miles Wicks. Resident in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Hopkins County in 1850. Day laborer in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 99B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 700.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 601.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Seminary, p. 139B-140A.
